name: Kepler-293
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-293 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-293 is a star with 0.887 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.96 times its radius. It is located 3269.75 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-293 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-293 b

Kepler-293 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 19.25 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-293.

The mass of Kepler-293 b is 14.22 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-293 b is 3.07 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-293 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-293 c

Kepler-293 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 54.16 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-293.

The mass of Kepler-293 c is 24.20 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-293 c is 3.83 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-293 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-293, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
